2.title: "Censure : Comics à l'Index"
2.author: Bernard Joubert
2.appears_in: p. 58-61 in Les Cahiers de la Bande Dessinée, no. 89 (June 1990).
notes: (Actualités)
On censorship of comics.

3.title: La Censure de la Bande Dessinée en France entre Analyse et Justification. "Contrairement à un Mythe Tenace : La Censure de la Bande Dessinée en France entre Analyse et Justification"
3.author: Harry Morgan
3.appears_in: p. 140-145 in 9e Art : Les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 8 (Jan. 2003).
notes: (Répliques)
On censorship of French comics, in response to a book by Thierry Crépin, titled Haro sur le Gangster.

4.title: "La Censure est-elle un Art?"
4.author: Caran d'Ache
4.appears_in: p. 42 in Pages d'Histoire : Album (Paris : Librairie du Figaro, 1904?)

6.heading: La Censure.
6.title: Encyclopédie de la bande dessinée érotique
6.author: Henri Filippini. Nouv. éd.

7.heading: Census.
7.title: The Blank in the Comics strip collection includes a file of one or more daily comic strips related to this keyword or topic. Call no.: PN6726 f.B55
7.author: [No author]

8.title: Census
8.author: Ken Ernst.
8.series: Mar. 11, 1950) "A Census-Taker Called, and When I Asked for His Credentials, He Ran!"
notes: Summary: Brick thinks Peggy Marvel's masquerade will damage Jimmy's heart, Mr. Kalkenbrooms' trust in humanity, and the Purchess Advertising Agency's reputation; meanwhile something odd happened at home too.

9.title: Census
9.author: by Johnny Hart.
9.series: Feb 8, 1988) "He's Taken Leave of His Census?"*
notes: Summary: The other census-taker is on leave.

10.title: Census
10.author: by Johnny Hart.
10.series: Feb. 9, 1988) "How Many Turtles Do You Have Living Here?"*
notes: Summary: The census taker is a turtle.

11.title: Census
11.author: Hart.
11.series: Feb. 11, 1988) "How 'Bout Elephant Bookends, a Slinky, and a Wok?"*
notes: Summary: The census taker asks if they have a bathtub, a kitchen sink and a stove.

12.title: Census
12.author: Parker.
12.series: Oct. 14, 1988) "It's Scrolling Through the Last Census"*
notes: Summary: The fortuneteller sees in her crystal ball that someone wants to harm the king, and he asks who it is.

13.title: Census
13.author: G
13.series: Apr. 3, 1990) "The Male Yak Approaches His Mate Cautiously"*
notes: Summary: The census form will have to wait until Elmont finishes the wildlife special.

14.title: Census
14.author: G
14.series: Apr. 4, 1990) "Wrong! I Knew Both my Parents!"*
notes: Suummary: Elmont has filled out the census form, though we don't know how since he's illiterate.

15.title: Census
15.author: G
15.series: Apr. 7, 1990) "What Makes Them So Special? Have They Done Letterman?"*
notes: Summary: The census taker is trying to count the homeless, and Elmont wants to know about the helpless, the rootless, the toothless, the young, and the restless.

16.title: Census
16.author: Johnson.
16.series: Apr. 16, 1990) "Dad's Letting Me Help Fill Out Our Census Form"*
notes: Summary: Gene counts his mother and himself.

17.title: Census
17.author: Chris Browne.
17.series: May 16, 1990) "They Must Think I'm a Census Taker"*
notes: Summary: Hagar hails a castle, and immediately gets a shower of rocks, arrows and spears.

18.title: Census
18.author: Russell Myers.
18.series: May 29, 1990) "Cecilia, Point the Pit Bull at the Front Door and Give Him a Whack!"*
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda the census taker gets a little too familiar with her questions.

19.title: Census
19.author: Russell Myers.
19.series: May 30, 1990) "Guys, I'm Going to Need Those Forms Back"*
notes: Summary: Irwin the census taker has counted three million for the day because he found an ant colony. He didn't realize it was only for people.

20.title: Census
20.author: Russell Myers.
20.series: May 31, 1990) "None of Us is Actually What You'd Call Living"*
notes: Summary: Working for the census, Broom-Hilda asks how many people live there. Answer: his wife, 12 kids, both mothers, her brother, his uncle and his uncle's girlfriend and a Rottweiler, in a 2-bedroom house.

21.title: Census
21.author: Art-Chip.
21.series: June 1, 1990) "Census? Heck, I'm Lookin' for a Date!"*
notes: Summary: A man at the door asks Gladys personal questions, and she gets suspicious.

22.title: Census
22.author: Chris Browne.
22.series: June 22, 1991) "Are You the Head of the Household?"*
notes: Summary: Hagar takes the census taker out of Helga's hearing before responding to the question.

23.title: Census
23.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Dagwood forgets to count the dog when he responds to the man at the door (a census of some kind?) with the clipboard; Daisy's crestfallen.

24.title: Census
24.author: [No author]
24.series: Oct. 1, 1999) "Remember, an Accurate Count Could Mean More Money for an Area, and More Congressmen to Spend It"

25.title: Census
25.author: by Leigh Rubin.
25.series: Oct. 6, 1999) "That is Exactly What the Last Wildlife Census Taker Said!"*
notes: Summary: The bears are undercounted because they eat everything but bones and clipboard.

26.title: Census
26.author: Johnson.
notes: Summary: Arlo wants to answer the question about sex with 'no complaints.'

27.title: Census
27.author: Aaron McGruder.
27.series: July 6, 2000) "Didn't I Tell You to Cut the Grass?"*
notes: Summary: Huey turns up with Granddad on his census job, and Granddad is not pleased to see him.

28.title: Census
28.author: by Aaron McGruder.
28.series: Aug. 4, 2000) "Did I Mention I May Be Suffering from Clinical Procrastination?"*
notes: Huey gave Riley the census job, then rushed back to mow the lawn like he was supposed to, though he hasn't actually done it yet.

29.title: Census
29.author: Guy & Rodd.
29.series: Mar. 12, 2005) "I Probably Should Have Been Writing This Down"*
notes: Summary: A census taker loses count.

30.title: "Census? Heck, I'm Lookin' for a Date!"
30.author: Art-Chip.
notes: Summary: A man at the door asks Gladys personal questions, and she gets suspicious.

31.title: "A Census-Taker Called, and When I Asked for His Credentials, He Ran!"
31.author: Ken Ernst.
notes: Summary: Brick thinks Peggy Marvel's masquerade will damage Jimmy's heart, Mr. Kalkenbrooms' trust in humanity, and the Purchess Advertising Agency's reputation; meanwhile something odd happened at home too.
